Name: Collapsible
Description: An interactive component which expands/collapses a panel.

SubComponentData.Name: Root
SubComponentData.Description: Contains all the parts of a collapsible.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: defaultOpen
PropData.Description: The open state of the collapsible when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its open state.

PropData.Name: open
PropData.Description: The controlled open state of the collapsible. Must be used in conjunction with onOpenChange.

PropData.Name: onOpenChange
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the collapsible changes.

PropData.Name: disabled
PropData.Description: Event handler called when the open state of the collapsible changes.

SubComponentData.Name: Trigger
SubComponentData.Description: The button that toggles the collapsible.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

SubComponentData.Name: Content
SubComponentData.Description: The component that contains the collapsible content.

PropData.Name: asChild
PropData.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

PropData.Name: forceMount
PropData.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries.
